article.headline: Marshall 60, Pikeville 49
article.story: HUNTINGTON, W.Va. (AP) -- New Marshall head coach Donnie Jones opened the 2007-08 regular season with a 60-49 victory over Pikeville, his alma mater, on Tuesday. Markel Humphrey led Marshall (1-0) with a team-high 21 points on 8-of-10 shooting. Tirrell Baines chipped in 10 points and 9 rebounds, and Mark Dorris added 10 points. William Harris and Jeff Ferguson were the only double-digit scorers for Pikeville (2-2) with 13 and 10 points, respectively. After trailing by 11 at halftime, Pikeville pulled within two points to make it 44-42 following 3-point baskets by Anthony Ighodaro and Justin Hicks with 6:38 remaining in the contest. Despite shooting 50 percent from the charity stripe (15-30), Marshall was able to hold off Pikeville by hitting 8-of-10 free-throw attempts in the final six minutes. With a new up-tempo style of play, Marshall caused 23 Pikeville turnovers and had 13 steals. Pikeville led 14-11 with 8:30 remaining in the first half, but Marshall put together a 16-2 run to lead 27-16 at the break. Humphrey had 13 of his 21 points in the first half.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
